commit_message:
DNM: Commit to test neutron worker refactor

The previous neutron worker refactor broke networking-ovn
before it was reverted. This patch set tests the updated
refactor to ensure it doesn't break networking-ovn again.

Change-Id: Id7d8e9deeec264f01610be3a7e807631ed12476b
Depends-On: I3a32a95489831f0d862930384309eefdc881d8f6

commit_message:
Remove voting gate v3 only job

This job was set as a voting gate job on only devstack and tempest.
However, there was no equivalent coverage in check (there was only a
nv v3 only job) Additionally, there were no other projects with a
voting v3 only job. This commit removes this as it's clearly not
something we should be gating on and leaves us open to wedging either
tempest or devstack with a change in one of the projects.

Change-Id: Id2f9cca1a9d0b7394f9c3d6e75fed097a72fc94e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/36/315636/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Revert "Changing gate on devstack identity v3 only voting"

This job was set as a voting gate job on only devstack and tempest.
However, there was no equivalent coverage in check (there was only a
nv v3 only job) Additionally, there were no other projects with a
voting v3 only job. This commit removes this as it's clearly not
something we should be gating on and leaves us open to wedging either
tempest or devstack with a change in one of the projects.

This reverts commit aed321fae933b6b59153fef80068343d3b60cbb5.

Change-Id: I0c1e0520ee1a1234d7fbea98e2e04d3c29885610
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/38/315638/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Raise an exception for domains already registered

This patch is replacing a sys.exit() in the VirtualBMCManager.add()
method with an exception, the manager class should never use the exit
syscall.

Change-Id: I49bb4107e57ce11a851203a04f48621a6f5439b7

commit_message:
Remove use of is_temporary() in resource cleanup

Remove use of is_temporary() defined in keystone scenario
utils in resource cleanup. Instead call name_matches_object()
directly from rally.common.utils.

Change-Id: Ie2dfb5c602f14e022f8cde20df2aeaf572ce0eb7

commit_message:
Fixing the deprecated library function.

os.popen() is deprecated since version 2.6. Resolved with use of
subprocess module.

commit_message:
Provide configurability of networks created for Tempest testing

The public and private network can now be customized using Ansible
variables:
 * tempest_private_network_provider_network_type
 * tempest_private_network_provider_physical_network
 * tempest_private_network_provider_segmentation_id
 * tempest_public_network_provider_network_type
 * tempest_public_network_provider_physical_network

Closes-Bug: #1580292
Change-Id: I13fe502165bc74d00b00033009d84d41a8cbf6f0

commit_message:
Failed migration shoudn't be reported as in progress

This fix add 'failed' status to the list of filters for migrations that are
reported by migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node.

Change-Id: I7de143d73a84339d2184d09e5907cbbe941a2e66
Closes-Bug: #1543123
(cherry picked from commit 0f8f854c2646e2e6677efdf8b1bbf82faf57f01f)

commit_message:
Don't track migrations in 'accepted' state

This state was added during Liberty for evacuate, and since it's the
first state that is assigned to the migration record on it's creation,
and before we start using it for resource tracking, there is no reason
to consider those records as "in progress".

Change-Id: I2a9bbe87bc1518cee9e43e4eeec1fa585305f423
Related-bug: 1417667
(cherry picked from commit 2c1f8e6002850a38c82739839be7245b786c9c0c)

commit_message:
Add doc/ to pep8 check

We had unused imports there, this would prevent us from letting more of
such errors in.

Change-Id: Ie78c18dd3b9ab34370e47eba98b32740e0c83e1d

commit_message:
Implements configurable connection factory

new - create new connection each times
single - use single connection for whole transport
read_write - use two connections for whole transport
                    (one for listening and one for sending)

Change-Id: I464c83beb498453b6df2237e7b8022d47ca3fa14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/64/310664/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_messaging._drivers.pika_driver import pika_connection_factory self.url = url self._connection_factory = ( pika_connection_factory.PikaConnectionFactory(url, conf) ) self.host_connection_reconnect_delay = ( conf.oslo_messaging_pika.host_connection_reconnect_delay ) return self._connection_factory.create_connection(for_listening)
deleted_lines: import os import random import socket import threading import time from oslo_log import log as logging import pika from pika import credentials as pika_credentialsfrom oslo_messaging._drivers.pika_driver import pika_connectionLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) _PID = None # constants for creating connection statistics HOST_CONNECTION_LAST_TRY_TIME = "last_try_time" HOST_CONNECTION_LAST_SUCCESS_TRY_TIME = "last_success_try_time" # constant for setting tcp_user_timeout socket option # (it should be defined in 'select' module of standard library in future) TCP_USER_TIMEOUT = 18 self._tcp_user_timeout = self.conf.oslo_messaging_pika.tcp_user_timeout self.host_connection_reconnect_delay = ( self.conf.oslo_messaging_pika.host_connection_reconnect_delay ) self._heartbeat_interval = ( self.conf.oslo_messaging_pika.heartbeat_interval ) # initializing connection parameters for configured RabbitMQ hosts self._common_pika_params = { 'virtual_host': url.virtual_host, 'channel_max': self.conf.oslo_messaging_pika.channel_max, 'frame_max': self.conf.oslo_messaging_pika.frame_max, 'ssl': self.conf.oslo_messaging_pika.ssl, 'ssl_options': self.conf.oslo_messaging_pika.ssl_options, 'socket_timeout': self.conf.oslo_messaging_pika.socket_timeout, } self._connection_lock = threading.RLock() self._pid = None self._connection_host_status = {} if not url.hosts: raise ValueError("You should provide at least one RabbitMQ host") self._host_list = url.hosts self._cur_connection_host_num = random.randint( 0, len(self._host_list) - 1 ) """Create and return connection to any available host. :return: created connection :raise: ConnectionException if all hosts are not reachable """ with self._connection_lock: self._init_if_needed() host_count = len(self._host_list) connection_attempts = host_count while connection_attempts > 0: self._cur_connection_host_num += 1 self._cur_connection_host_num %= host_count try: return self.create_host_connection( self._cur_connection_host_num, for_listening ) except pika_pool.Connection.connectivity_errors as e: LOG.warning("Can't establish connection to host. %s", e) except pika_drv_exc.HostConnectionNotAllowedException as e: LOG.warning("Connection to host is not allowed. %s", e) connection_attempts -= 1 raise pika_drv_exc.EstablishConnectionException( "Can not establish connection to any configured RabbitMQ " "host: " + str(self._host_list) ) def _set_tcp_user_timeout(self, s): if not self._tcp_user_timeout: return try: s.setsockopt( socket.IPPROTO_TCP, self.TCP_USER_TIMEOUT, int(self._tcp_user_timeout * 1000) ) except socket.error: LOG.warning( "Whoops, this kernel doesn't seem to support TCP_USER_TIMEOUT." ) def _init_if_needed(self): global _PID cur_pid = os.getpid() if _PID != cur_pid: if _PID: LOG.warning("New pid is detected. Old: %s, new: %s. " "Cleaning up...", _PID, cur_pid) # Note(dukhlov): we need to force select poller usage in case when # 'thread' module is monkey patched becase current eventlet # implementation does not support patching of poll/epoll/kqueue if pika_drv_cmns.is_eventlet_monkey_patched("thread"): from pika.adapters import select_connection select_connection.SELECT_TYPE = "select" _PID = cur_pid def create_host_connection(self, host_index, for_listening=False): """Create new connection to host #host_index :param host_index: Integer, number of host for connection establishing :param for_listening: Boolean, creates connection for listening if True :return: New connection """ with self._connection_lock: self._init_if_needed() host = self._host_list[host_index] connection_params = pika.ConnectionParameters( host=host.hostname, port=host.port, credentials=pika_credentials.PlainCredentials( host.username, host.password ), heartbeat_interval=( self._heartbeat_interval if for_listening else None ), **self._common_pika_params ) cur_time = time.time() host_connection_status = self._connection_host_status.get(host) if host_connection_status is None: host_connection_status = { self.HOST_CONNECTION_LAST_SUCCESS_TRY_TIME: 0, self.HOST_CONNECTION_LAST_TRY_TIME: 0 } self._connection_host_status[host] = host_connection_status last_success_time = host_connection_status[ self.HOST_CONNECTION_LAST_SUCCESS_TRY_TIME ] last_time = host_connection_status[ self.HOST_CONNECTION_LAST_TRY_TIME ] # raise HostConnectionNotAllowedException if we tried to establish # connection in last 'host_connection_reconnect_delay' and got # failure if (last_time != last_success_time and cur_time - last_time < self.host_connection_reconnect_delay): raise pika_drv_exc.HostConnectionNotAllowedException( "Connection to host #{} is not allowed now because of " "previous failure".format(host_index) ) try: if for_listening: connection = pika_connection.ThreadSafePikaConnection( params=connection_params ) else: connection = pika.BlockingConnection( parameters=connection_params ) connection.params = connection_params self._set_tcp_user_timeout(connection._impl.socket) self._connection_host_status[host][ self.HOST_CONNECTION_LAST_SUCCESS_TRY_TIME ] = cur_time return connection finally: self._connection_host_status[host][ self.HOST_CONNECTION_LAST_TRY_TIME ] = cur_time

commit_message:
Fix qos_manage uuid warnings in api.contrib tests

This commit fixes invalid uuid usage in the qos_manage unit tests
under cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib, cleaning up FutureWarnings
from oslo_versioned_objects [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: Ibc17282732521e6c51e314e3d9e9f0fad80a2fd6

commit_message:
Changing gate on devstack identity v3 only voting

Keystone team decided to deprecate API v2.0 on Mitaka,
since the API v3 it's now the stable API version, this
patch change the devstack gate to be voting.

This patch is part of the plan on this etherpad:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/v3-only-devstack

Besided that, we investigate a couple of issues related to this point
and in a few points, we need to work on:

* Lack of "v3 only" jobs on gates (job on Tempest and Devstack be
  voting, create other service v3 only jobs)
* V3 only devstack fails in some projects like Ironic;
* Lack of keystoneauth session usage in some service clients;
* Delete the Hardcoded v2.0 usage like using v2 url, tenant variables;
* Remove the Keystone CLI usage, like in Nova gate;
* Change v2.0 service tokens to be v3: Hardwritten, automated tools
* OpenStack Client Config
* Add v3 operations tests in Tempest

Change-Id: I3fcc09475b8e76d2a7d95934ba45c6b3a6c4546e

subject: Mysql GTID replication fails when data inserted
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 14:47:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/38d94c3e0ca818e494732d5bd972fabd6f701667', 'message': "Mysql GTID replication fails when data inserted

If you have a master and a slave configured and you insert
new data into the master, it will cause subsequent replica
create to fail.

The problem is that we weren't setting the gtid_purged variable
using the metadata in the xtrabackup_binlog_info file. The
Mysql GTID replication strategy was adjusted to account for this.

The replication scenario tests were enhanced to validate this
issue.

Note: this issue doesn't occur with MariaDB GTID replication

commit_message:
Mysql GTID replication fails when data inserted

If you have a master and a slave configured and you insert
new data into the master, it will cause subsequent replica
create to fail.

The problem is that we weren't setting the gtid_purged variable
using the metadata in the xtrabackup_binlog_info file. The
Mysql GTID replication strategy was adjusted to account for this.

A release note has been added.

The replication scenario tests were enhanced to validate this
issue.

Note: this issue doesn't occur with MariaDB GTID replication
because it mechanism is different.

Scenario tests were run succesfully on Mysql, Percona and
MariaDB with this change in place.

Change-Id: I66c8b6278afa50ba14e4bb7888e3a25dc657a9e4
Closes-bug: 1563574

commit_message:
Update Designate Architecture document

Updating high level chart and adding a section for zone-manager.

Change-Id: If838cfd394f654ed6fd8331a531947d48e7ca68c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/09/315209/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. image:: images/Designate-Arch.png.. _designate-zone-manager: Designate Zone Manager ----------------------- designate-zone-manager is a service that handle all periodic tasks relating to the zone shard it is responsible for. A zone shard is a collection of zones allocated based on first three characters of zone UUID. The current implemented periodic tasks in zone manager include emitting dns.zone.exists events for Ceilometer, purging deleted zones from database, polling secondary zones at their refresh intervals, and generating delayed NOTIFY transactions.

commit_message:
Set endpoint_override while doing session.request

The recent refactor broke multi-region deployments by not using
endpoint_override when doing _http_request in SessionClient.
This change fixes it.

Closes-bug: #1557105
Change-Id: I99cbcd34eeec1388a00d1a0d910dd5759191f954

commit_message:
Prepare for non voting pylint target

1. Add tox targets
2. Fix trivial issues for few error classes
3. Sync pylintrc from fuel-qa
4. @staticmethod
5. define outside __init__

Change-Id: I8567d866369defc3887c7c47c7d3c1130aa0f663

commit_message:
Helper method to use dnf instead of yum on fedora >=22

There are multiple places where packages may be installed
at cluster launch time or even during the run of an EDP
job (for instance on-demand manila share mounting).

Fedora is transitioning from use of 'yum' to 'dnf'.
While yum is still available in F22 and F23, it has
been deprecated and ultimately will be replaced with dnf.

This helper method will process said install commands using dnf
on yum 22 and above and yum otherwise.

Based on feedback, replacing the new method by modifying the
one in ssh_remote instead.
Change-Id: If0f0356710293da16e047481166991a0287d6f17
Closes-Bug:1561153
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/01/303601/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Helper methods for using dnf instead of yum on fedora >= 22. """ from ssh_remote import _get_os_distrib, _execute_command from sahara import exceptions as ex def _get_os_version(): return _execute_command( ('printf "import platform\nprint(platform.linux_distribution()[1])"' ' | python'), run_as_root=False) def _install_packages(packages): distrib = _get_os_distrib() if distrib == 'ubuntu': cmd = 'RUNLEVEL=1 apt-get install -y %(pkgs)s' elif distrib == 'fedora': fversion = _get_os_version() if fversion >= 22: cmd = 'dnf install -y %(pkgs)s' else: cmd = 'yum install -y %(pkgs)s' elif distrib in ('redhat', 'centos'): cmd = 'yum install -y %(pkgs)s' else: raise ex.NotImplementedException( _('Package Installation'), _('%(fmt)s is not implemented for OS %(distrib)s') % { 'fmt': '%s', 'distrib': distrib}) cmd = cmd % {'pkgs': ' '.join(packages)} _execute_command(cmd, run_as_root=True) def _update_repository(): distrib = _get_os_distrib() if distrib == 'ubuntu': cmd = 'apt-get update' elif distrib == 'fedora': fversion = _get_os_version() if fversion >= 22: cmd = 'dnf clean all' else: cmd = 'yum clean all' elif distrib in ('redhat', 'centos'): cmd = 'yum clean all' else: raise ex.NotImplementedException( _('Repository Update'), _('%(fmt)s is not implemented for OS %(distrib)s') % { 'fmt': '%s', 'distrib': distrib}) _execute_command(cmd, run_as_root=True)

commit_message:
Make metadata server pre-query for keypairs

Since we use this in metadata, we should avoid the lazy-load.

Related to blueprint cells-keypairs-api-db

Change-Id: I99ac11f31ac2c73e2aec027d77da162295d3eff3

freezer-agent --nova-inst-id 1983bb28-b962-4597-ab83-c7529594c1c5
--restore-from-date 2016-04-28T09:55:50 --storage local
--container /home/nfs

Closes-Bug: #1576008
Implements blueprint: backup-nova-cinder-to-non-swift

Change-Id: I81a0c12207f4f52d97857e852ba18c7dfe92bc48
'}]
commit_message:
Backup nova to local

Now, freezer-agent backup nova to swift by default.
but more and more demand  backup it to the specified directory.
This patch fix it backup it to local.

backup nova usage:
freezer-agent --nova-inst-id 1983bb28-b962-4597-ab83-c7529594c1c5
--storage local --container /home/nfs

restore nova usage:

freezer-agent --nova-inst-id 1983bb28-b962-4597-ab83-c7529594c1c5
--restore-from-date 2016-04-28T09:55:50 --storage local
--container /home/nfs

Closes-Bug: #1576008
Implements blueprint: backup-nova-cinder-to-non-swift

Change-Id: I81a0c12207f4f52d97857e852ba18c7dfe92bc48

added_lines: import os def __init__(self, client_manager, container, storage,backup_storage): self.storage = storage self.backup_storage = backup_storage def _create_image(self, path, restore_from_timestamp, container): :param path: backup path :param restore_from_timestamp: :param container: get the container of backup container = self.container.rstrip("/") if self.backup_storage == 'swift': swift = self.client_manager.get_swift() backup = self._get_backups(path, restore_from_timestamp) stream = swift.get_object( self.container, "%s/%s" % (path, backup), resp_chunk_size=10000000) length = int(stream[0]["x-object-meta-length"]) image = glance.images.create( disk_format="qcow2") return stream[0], image else : image_dir = "{0}/{1}".format(container, path) if not image_dir: msg = "Cannot find backups for path: %s" % image_dir logging.error(msg) l = os.listdir(image_dir) backuplist = [int(x) for x in l if x.isdigit()] get_restore_timestamp = [x for x in backuplist if x >= restore_from_timestamp] if not get_restore_timestamp: backupdir = max(backuplist) else: backupdir = min(get_restore_timestamp) image_dir = "{0}/{1}/{2}".format(container, path, backupdir) image_file = "{0}/instance-{1}".format(image_dir, path) with open(image_file) as instance_file : image = glance.images.create( data=instance_file, container_format="bare", disk_format="qcow2", name=backupdir) return image def restore_nova(self, instance_id, restore_from_timestamp,container): container = self.container client_manager = self.client_manager instance_id = instance_id nova = client_manager.get_nova() instance = nova.servers.get(instance_id) flavor = instance._info['flavor']['id'] #(info, image) = self._create_image(instance_id, restore_from_timestamp) image = self._create_image(instance_id, restore_from_timestamp,container=self.container) #image = image.id # nova = self.client_manager.get_nova() # flavor = nova.flavors.get(info['x-object-meta-flavor-id']) #nova.servers.create(info['x-object-meta-name'], image, flavor) nova.servers.create(instance._info['name'], image, flavor)
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, client_manager, container): def _create_image(self, path, restore_from_timestamp): :param path: :param restore_from_timestamp: swift = self.client_manager.get_swift() backup = self._get_backups(path, restore_from_timestamp) stream = swift.get_object( self.container, "%s/%s" % (path, backup), resp_chunk_size=10000000) length = int(stream[0]["x-object-meta-length"]) image = glance.images.create( disk_format="raw") return stream[0], image def restore_nova(self, instance_id, restore_from_timestamp): (info, image) = self._create_image(instance_id, restore_from_timestamp) nova = self.client_manager.get_nova() flavor = nova.flavors.get(info['x-object-meta-flavor-id']) nova.servers.create(info['x-object-meta-name'], image, flavor)

commit_message:
Mark additional tasks info column as deferred

Fields:

- deployment_info;
- cluster_settings;
- network_settings.

in sum take 150Mb for cluster with 200 nodes. Every task
request will create heavy db select, so it will take
a lot of memory, cpu load and dramatically decrease
receiver performance.

With this change this fields will be loaded only if
Nailgun directly required them.

Change-Id: I2417b0370914a0bd3a7f92e897826d9d86e76773
Closes-Bug: #1570509

commit_message:
Fix huge pages related opts behavior

Make sure that $hugepages_1g_opts_ensure is always set as a case is possible
when this variable is not set, file_line will treate it as 'present'

Change-Id: I1b89195564ee41e8b04833bdb131d7e3a7f7f089
Closes-bug: #1578623

commit_message:
Add 'force' param for DeploySelectedNodesWithTasks

DeploySelectedNodesWithTasks is intended to run only specified set of
tasks on specified nodes. In Fuel 9.0 LCM serializers have been
introduced, hence tasks are skipped if their condition return 'False'
(and it does, since no changes may introduced).

This introduces inconvenience for operators, who want to run particular
task on nodes and do not care if there were changes or not. That's why
this commit introduces the '?force' HTTP parameter for the mentioned
handler. If 'force' is true, the task will be executed unconditionally.

Closes-Bug: #1578974

Depends-On: Icbaa2bd72c5ff2fc128a0dab4b22d6db77dd36fb
Change-Id: Iaf005341468a4e35cd82586ba3f7b585fdf4752c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/68/315168/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: force = params.force or None task = env.execute_tasks( node_collection.collection, tasks=tasks, force=force)

commit_message:
[WIP] Get rid of boot partitions on "raid"

Current partitioning schema contains at least 3 partitions per disk.
These partitions are used only on bootable disk. So, if we have, for
example, node with 64 disks, this node has 189 useless partitions.

With this patch nailgun only reserve 0.5Gb of space on each disk and
let the fuel-agent decide, what required boot partions should be
created.

Change-Id: I9a656dc516f70ffbf9fc5d73d078ca697063a364
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/01/315301/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: boot_data_size = volume_manager.call_generator('calc_boot_size') boot_size = volume_manager.call_generator('calc_boot_size') def create_disk(self, possible_pvs_count=0): possible_pvs_count=possible_pvs_count)
deleted_lines: boot_data_size = volume_manager.call_generator('calc_boot_size') + \ volume_manager.call_generator('calc_boot_records_size') boot_size = volume_manager.call_generator('calc_boot_size') + \ volume_manager.call_generator('calc_boot_records_size') def get_boot(self, volumes): return filter( lambda volume: volume.get('mount') == '/boot', volumes)[0] def create_disk(self, boot_is_raid=False, possible_pvs_count=0): boot_is_raid=boot_is_raid, possible_pvs_count=possible_pvs_count) def test_create_mbr_as_raid_if_disks_count_greater_than_zero(self): disk = self.create_disk(boot_is_raid=True) boot_partition = self.get_boot(disk.volumes) self.assertEqual(boot_partition['type'], 'raid') def test_create_mbr_as_partition_if_disks_count_less_than_zero(self): disk = self.create_disk() boot_partition = self.get_boot(disk.volumes) self.assertEqual(boot_partition['type'], 'partition') def test_boot_partition_has_file_system(self): disk = self.create_disk(possible_pvs_count=1) boot_record = filter( lambda volume: volume.get('mount') == '/boot', disk.volumes)[0] self.assertEqual(boot_record['file_system'], 'ext2')

commit_message:
Fix for address allocation respecting existing libvirt networks

listDefinedNetworks() show only stopped networks, skipping 'active'
networks.
To get all libvirt networks, let's use listAllNetworks()

Change-Id: Id86496af007dbb28ce78bfd239b30fba36cc39cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/63/315563/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow freezer to use trickle installed system wide

Freezer is using trickle only if it's installed system wide and not
looking for trickle-overload.so library anymore. Users have to
install trickle: apt-get install trickle or yum install trickle
for freezer to use it.

Closes-Bug: #1553159
(cherry picked from commit de0344b4c845e6d0bd5c8961648a809e84bf6d93)

Conflicts:
	README.rst
Change-Id: I49efff29876990dfd0782e3cf5ad68daf3e6055d

[DNS] Unbound DNS app added

Change-Id: I1cf92e4841b2e9f12288e5e05a057be1d89a3b08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-apps refs/changes/08/272308/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash iam=$(whoami) logger Installing Unbound DNS. User=$iam UNBOUND_CONF=/etc/unbound/unbound.conf # sudo apt-get -y update # remove the others dns servers if installed sudo apt-get -y remove bind9 sudo apt-get -y remove dnsmasq sudo service unbound stop || true sudo apt-get -y install unbound # backup default config logger 'mv $UNBOUND_CONF $UNBOUND_CONF.default' || true sudo -E bash -c 'mv $UNBOUND_CONF $UNBOUND_CONF.default' || true # create new config read -r -d '' CONFIG_CONTENT <<'EOF' server: access-control: 127.0.0.0/8 allow auto-trust-anchor-file: "/var/lib/unbound/root.key" verbosity: 1 statistics-interval: 120 num-threads: 1 interface: 0.0.0.0 do-udp: yes do-tcp: yes outgoing-range: 512 num-queries-per-thread: 1024 msg-cache-size: 16m rrset-cache-size: 32m msg-cache-slabs: 4 rrset-cache-slabs: 4 cache-max-ttl: 86400 infra-host-ttl: 60 infra-lame-ttl: 120 infra-cache-numhosts: 10000 infra-cache-lame-size: 10k do-ip4: yes do-ip6: no do-udp: yes do-tcp: yes do-daemonize: yes use-syslog: yes identity: "DNS" version: "1.4" hide-identity: yes hide-version: yes harden-glue: yes do-not-query-address: 127.0.0.1/8 do-not-query-localhost: yes module-config: "iterator" local-zone: "localhost." static local-data: "localhost. 10800 IN NS localhost." local-data: "localhost. 10800 IN SOA localhost. nobody.invalid. 1 3600 1200 604800 10800" local-data: "localhost. 10800 IN A 127.0.0.1" forward-zone: name: "." forward-addr: 8.8.8.8 forward-addr: 8.8.4.4 forward-addr: 208.67.222.222 forward-addr: 208.67.220.220 remote-control: control-enable: yes control-interface: 0.0.0.0 control-port: 953 server-key-file: "/etc/unbound/unbound_server.key" server-cert-file: "/etc/unbound/unbound_server.pem" control-key-file: "/etc/unbound/unbound_control.key" control-cert-file: "/etc/unbound/unbound_control.pem" EOF echo $CONFIG_CONTENT > $UNBOUND_CONF sudo chown -R unbound:root /etc/unbound sudo chmod 777 /etc/unbound/ cd /etc/unbound/ # gen SSL keys sudo -u unbound unbound-control-setup sudo chmod 644 /etc/unbound/unbound_* unbound-checkconf /etc/unbound/unbound.conf sudo service unbound restart # check if unbound-control is working unbound-control reload

commit_message:
Message queue connection switching for cells

In order for Nova API to send RPC messages to cells, the message queue
connection information for the target cell must be used. Nova API must
pass the cell message queue information to the RPC API layer.

Related to blueprint cells-mq-connection-switching

Change-Id: Id9b73264dbc9eb4d6d652dbed7997ceae1364d7e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/51/298551/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================ Message queue connection switching for cells ============================================ Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/cells-mq-connection-switching In order for Nova API to send RPC messages to cells, the message queue connection information for the target cell must be used. Nova API must pass the cell message queue information to the RPC API layer. Problem description =================== In Cells v2, instead of using a nova-cells proxy, nova-api will interact directly with the database and message queue of the cell for an instance. Instance -> cell mappings are stored in a table in the API level database. Each InstanceMapping refers to a CellMapping, and the CellMapping contains the connection information for the cell. We need a way to communicate the message queue connection information from the CellMapping to the RPC API layer, so when we receive a request to act upon an instance, the message will be forwarded to the cell where the instance resides. Use Cases --------- * Operators want to partition their deployments into cells for scaling, failure domain, and buildout reasons. When partitioned, we need a way to route messages to the cell for an instance. Proposed change =============== We propose to store the message queue connection information for a cell in the RequestContext where it can be used by the RPC API layer to interact with the cell message queue. Currently, there is only one message queue that can be used at the RPC API layer and it is a global transport. We will want to be able to create a transport dynamically based on message queue connection data if it is present in the RequestContext. The field 'mq_connection' will be added to RequestContext to store the transport object for the cell message queue. When a request comes in, nova-api will look up the instance mapping in the API database. It will get the message queue information from the instance's CellMapping and store a transport object in the RequestContext 'mq_connection' field. Then, the RPC API layer will use the transport object for interacting with the cell message queue using the 'mq_connection' to forward the message. Alternatives ------------ What other ways could we do this thing? Why aren't we using those? This doesn't have to be a full literature review, but it should demonstrate that thought has been put into why the proposed solution is an appropriate one. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- The message queue connection field in the RequestContext could contain sensitive data. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ This change will create RPC transport objects dynamically based on connection information from the RequestContext. There is some overhead to this over the global transport object usually used for a single message queue. The overhead is the same as in Cells v1 as both Transport objects and RPCClient objects are created dynamically for each message sent to a cell. There is the possibility of caching objects keyed off of hashes of 'mq_connection' along with an expiration scheme if overhead becomes problematic. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- This change means that developers should be aware that cell message queue connection information is contained in the RequestContext and be mindful that it could contain sensitive data. Developers will need to use the interfaces for getting message queue connection information from a CellMapping and setting it in a RequestContext in order to interact with a cell message queue. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: melwitt Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Add a message queue connection field to RequestContext * Add message queue connection to the context manager in nova.context that populates a RequestContext with cell connection information given a CellMapping * Modify RPC layer and compute RPC API functions to use the message queue connection information from the context, if it's set Dependencies ============ * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/cells-v2-mapping * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/cells-instance-mapping Testing ======= Since no user visible changes will occur with this change, the current suite of Tempest or functional tests should be sufficient. Documentation Impact ==================== Developer documentation could be written to describe how to use the new interfaces. References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Newton - Introduced

commit_message:
The need to wait for a given time is no longer valid in 3.2+

The condition interrupt but is fixed in 3.2 so we can avoid
some of the legacy logic in that version (and eventually at
some point we can just remove that code).

Change-Id: I45a871a212bb06fb69c36405161a9e66601b0f0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/50/315350/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: crypto - Refactor server side copy as middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-22 15:14:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/saio/swift/proxy-server.conf', 'swift/common/middleware/versioned_writes.py', 'swift/common/middleware/server_side_copy.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'swift/common/wsgi.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_dlo.py', 'doc/source/logs.rst', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_server_side_copy.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_sysmeta.py', 'swift/common/constraints.py', 'test/unit/common/test_swob.py', 'test/unit/common/test_constraints.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'doc/source/middleware.rst', 'doc/source/overview_server_side_copy.rst', 'swift/proxy/server.py', 'swift/common/middleware/dlo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_versioned_writes.py', 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'swift/common/swob.py', 'setup.cfg', 'test/unit/common/middleware/helpers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/a791a6859806349e63d500ccc639fe22b044b652', 'message': "crypto - Refactor server side copy as middleware

Rewrite server side copy and 'object post as copy' feature as middleware to
simplify the PUT method in the object controller code. COPY is no longer
a verb implemented as public method in Proxy application.

The server side copy middleware is inserted to the left of dlo, slo and
versioned_writes middlewares in the proxy server pipeline. As a result,
dlo and slo copy_hooks are no longer required. SLO manifests are now
validated when copied so when copying a manifest to another account the
referenced segments must be readable in that account for the manifest
copy to succeed (previously this validation was not made, meaning the
manifest was copied but could be unusable if the segments were not
readable).

With this change, there should be no change in functionality or existing
behavior. This is asserted with (almost) no changes required to existing
functional tests.

Some notes (for operators):
* Middleware required to be auto-inserted before slo and dlo and
  versioned_writes
* Turning off server side copy is not configurable.
* object_post_as_copy is no longer a configurable option of proxy server
  but of this middleware. However, for smooth upgrade, config option set
  in proxy server app is also read.

DocImpact: Introducing server side copy as middleware

Change-Id: I538c3b1cea75975df99c41dcc4094c1e764cb994
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
crypto - Refactor server side copy as middleware

Rewrite server side copy and 'object post as copy' feature as middleware to
simplify the PUT method in the object controller code. COPY is no longer
a verb implemented as public method in Proxy application.

The server side copy middleware is inserted to the left of dlo, slo and
versioned_writes middlewares in the proxy server pipeline. As a result,
dlo and slo copy_hooks are no longer required. SLO manifests are now
validated when copied so when copying a manifest to another account the
referenced segments must be readable in that account for the manifest
copy to succeed (previously this validation was not made, meaning the
manifest was copied but could be unusable if the segments were not
readable).

With this change, there should be no change in functionality or existing
behavior. This is asserted with (almost) no changes required to existing
functional tests.

Some notes (for operators):
* Middleware required to be auto-inserted before slo and dlo and
  versioned_writes
* Turning off server side copy is not configurable.
* object_post_as_copy is no longer a configurable option of proxy server
  but of this middleware. However, for smooth upgrade, config option set
  in proxy server app is also read.

DocImpact: Introducing server side copy as middleware

Change-Id: I538c3b1cea75975df99c41dcc4094c1e764cb994
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Do not omit syncing the '*-all.log' syslog files

While parsing syslogtag from many sources we always should sync.

Change-Id: If9859950fb4c8704da0df5a6c715eaeb08ad3b51
Closes-Bug: #1573047
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8f10ba3e0bf83f249b44b79a4f9f1b9ae416e866)

commit_message:
Fix CG uuid warnings in api.contrib unit tests

This commit fixes invalid uuid usage in the consistency group
and cgsnapshot  unit tests under cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib,
cleaning up FutureWarnings from oslo_versioned_objects [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: I87b5212e5e5d64f9051819003b3717f72ba602d9

than op start timeout.

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add CinderVolumes.create_volume_and_clone

This creates one volume from another volume with the source_volid
option.

Change-Id: I0c42e06376c9f0f07a9505f1efe0a3f2ed09e421
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/71/314771/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from rally.task import atomic @types.convert(image={"type": "glance_image"}) @validation.image_exists("image", nullable=True) @validation.required_services(consts.Service.CINDER) @validation.required_openstack(users=True) @scenario.configure(context={"cleanup": ["cinder"]}) def create_volume_and_clone(self, size, image=None, **kwargs): """Create a volume, then clone it to another volume. :param size: volume size (integer, in GB) or dictionary, must contain two values: min - minimum size volumes will be created as; max - maximum size volumes will be created as. :param image: image to be used to create initial volume :param kwargs: optional args to create volumes """ if image: kwargs["imageRef"] = image vol1 = self._create_volume(size, **kwargs) kwargs.pop("imageRef", None) with atomic.ActionTimer(self, "cinder.clone_volume"): self._create_volume(size, source_volid=vol1.id, atomic_action=False, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Add a config for a minimum ttl

This ensures we can specify the minimum ttl to use when creating zones
or recordsets from random ttls, which includes some refactoring to use
a single method for generating ttls.

Change-Id: I5c8620ff5a15b935ba075bec1f9750dbae4ffb70

commit_message:
Publish debian packages after build

This patch adds an scp of the content of the uploads folder,
created after packages are built.

Change-Id: I0c3a930480a6496017ef32a85c5bec05679d9018
Depends-On: I477d169f2d2d567344e227659f54b962a68f24e4

commit_message:
Move logging outside of LibvirtConfigObject.to_xml

Logging the xml in LibvirtConfigObject doesn't provide
much context. Instead remove the logging from there and
move it to the caller where neccessary.

Log the instance when doing cpu comparison to add context
to the log messages.

Closes-Bug: #1491414
Change-Id: Ie7b9b41de40f10820a2b9e04198464cd2da46e8c

commit_message:
fix network unit test case

Since neutron code bases was changed because of bug fix [1], network unit
test for the Tricircle has to be updated becuase of dependencies.

For More Detail:
neutron/db/ipam_backend_mixin.py

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/288774/

Change-Id: I1142bdd75c1dd5d240d1d256d9687c2fe54612c8

commit_message:
Move extra computes tests into separated dir

- Separate base class for extra computes from tests
- Separate migration test from basic cases

Change-Id: I0c9c31d1d3a011ad0b0257f7a4ae34569e0c9fe8
Partial-Bug: #1569374
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/43/304643/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from __future__ import division from proboscis import asserts from proboscis import test from fuelweb_test.helpers import checkers from fuelweb_test.helpers.decorators import log_snapshot_after_test from fuelweb_test.helpers import os_actions from fuelweb_test import settings from fuelweb_test import logger from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import SetupEnvironment from fuelweb_test.tests.tests_extra_computes.base_extra_computes import RhBase @test(groups=['rh.migration']) class RhHAOneControllerMigration(RhBase): """RH-based compute HA migration test""" @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_5], groups=["check_vm_migration_rh_ha_one_controller_tun"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def check_vm_migration_rh_ha_one_controller_tun(self): """Deploy environment with RH and Ubuntu computes in HA mode with neutron VXLAN Scenario: 1. Check required image. 2. Revert snapshot 'ready_with_5_slaves'. 3. Create a Fuel cluster. 4. Update cluster nodes with required roles. 5. Deploy the Fuel cluster. 6. Run OSTF. 7. Backup astute.yaml and ssh keys from one of computes. 8. Boot compute with RH image. 9. Prepare node for Puppet run. 10. Execute modular tasks for compute. 11. Run OSTF. Duration: 150m Snapshot: check_vm_migration_rh_ha_one_controller_tun """ self.show_step(1, initialize=True) logger.debug('Check MD5 sum of RH 7 image') check_image = checkers.check_image( settings.RH_IMAGE, settings.RH_IMAGE_MD5, settings.RH_IMAGE_PATH) asserts.assert_true(check_image, 'Provided image is incorrect. ' 'Please, check image path and md5 sum of it.') self.show_step(2) self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_5_slaves") self.show_step(3) logger.debug('Create Fuel cluster RH-based compute tests') data = { 'net_provider': 'neutron', 'net_segment_type': settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['tun'], 'tenant': 'RhHAMigration', 'user': 'RhHAMigration', 'password': 'RhHAMigration', 'volumes_ceph': True, 'ephemeral_ceph': True, 'images_ceph': True, 'objects_ceph': True, 'osd_pool_size': "1" } cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=settings.DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings=data ) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['compute'], 'slave-03': ['compute'], 'slave-04': ['ceph-osd'], } ) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) cluster_vip = self.fuel_web.get_public_vip(cluster_id) os_conn = os_actions.OpenStackActions( cluster_vip, data['user'], data['password'], data['tenant']) self.show_step(6) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id=cluster_id, test_sets=['smoke', 'sanity']) self.show_step(7) compute_one = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles( cluster_id, ['compute'])[0] controller_ip = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles( cluster_id, ['controller'])[0]['ip'] logger.debug('Got node: {0}'.format(compute_one)) target_node_one = self.fuel_web.get_devops_node_by_nailgun_node( compute_one) logger.debug('DevOps Node: {0}'.format(target_node_one)) target_node_one_ip = compute_one['ip'] logger.debug('Acquired ip: {0} for node: {1}'.format( target_node_one_ip, target_node_one.name)) compute_two = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles( cluster_id, ['compute'])[1] logger.debug('Got node: {0}'.format(compute_two)) target_node_two = self.fuel_web.get_devops_node_by_nailgun_node( compute_two) logger.debug('DevOps Node: {0}'.format(target_node_two)) target_node_two_ip = compute_two['ip'] logger.debug('Acquired ip: {0} for node: {1}'.format( target_node_two_ip, target_node_two.name)) old_hostname_one = self.save_node_hostname(target_node_one_ip) old_hostname_two = self.save_node_hostname(target_node_two_ip) self.backup_required_information(self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, target_node_one_ip, ceph=True) self.backup_required_information(self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, target_node_two_ip, ceph=True, node=2) self.backup_hosts_file(self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, controller_ip) self.show_step(8) target_node_one.destroy() target_node_two.destroy() asserts.assert_false( target_node_one.driver.node_active(node=target_node_one), 'Target node still active') asserts.assert_false( target_node_two.driver.node_active(node=target_node_two), 'Target node still active') self.connect_rh_image(target_node_one) self.connect_rh_image(target_node_two) target_node_one.start() asserts.assert_true( target_node_one.driver.node_active(node=target_node_one), 'Target node did not start') self.wait_for_slave_provision(target_node_one_ip) target_node_two.start() asserts.assert_true( target_node_two.driver.node_active(node=target_node_two), 'Target node did not start') self.wait_for_slave_provision(target_node_two_ip) self.verify_image_connected(target_node_one_ip) self.verify_image_connected(target_node_two_ip) self.show_step(9) self.restore_information(target_node_one_ip, self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, ceph=True) self.restore_information(target_node_two_ip, self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, ceph=True, node=2) new_host_one = self.set_hostname(target_node_one_ip) if not settings.CENTOS_DUMMY_DEPLOY: self.register_rh_subscription(target_node_one_ip) self.install_yum_components(target_node_one_ip) if not settings.CENTOS_DUMMY_DEPLOY: self.enable_rh_repos(target_node_one_ip) self.set_repo_for_perestroika(target_node_one_ip) self.check_hiera_installation(target_node_one_ip) self.install_ruby_puppet(target_node_one_ip) self.check_rsync_installation(target_node_one_ip) new_host_two = self.set_hostname(target_node_two_ip, host_number=2) if not settings.CENTOS_DUMMY_DEPLOY: self.register_rh_subscription(target_node_two_ip) self.install_yum_components(target_node_two_ip) if not settings.CENTOS_DUMMY_DEPLOY: self.enable_rh_repos(target_node_two_ip) self.set_repo_for_perestroika(target_node_two_ip) self.check_hiera_installation(target_node_two_ip) self.install_ruby_puppet(target_node_two_ip) self.check_rsync_installation(target_node_two_ip) self.rsync_puppet_modules(self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, target_node_one_ip) self.rsync_puppet_modules(self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, target_node_two_ip) self.prepare_hosts_file(self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, old_hostname_one, new_host_one) self.prepare_hosts_file(self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, old_hostname_two, new_host_two) self.restore_hosts_file(self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, target_node_one_ip) self.restore_hosts_file(self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, target_node_two_ip) self.show_step(10) self.apply_first_part_puppet(target_node_one_ip) self.apply_first_part_puppet(target_node_two_ip) self.apply_networking_puppet(target_node_one_ip) self.apply_networking_puppet(target_node_two_ip) self.check_netconfig_success(target_node_one_ip) self.apply_last_part_puppet(target_node_one_ip, ceph=True) self.check_netconfig_success(target_node_two_ip) self.apply_last_part_puppet(target_node_two_ip, ceph=True) self.remove_old_compute_services(controller_ip, old_hostname_one) self.remove_old_compute_services(controller_ip, old_hostname_two) self.fuel_web.assert_cluster_ready(os_conn, smiles_count=6) self.show_step(11) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id=cluster_id, test_sets=['smoke', 'sanity']) self.env.make_snapshot("ready_ha_one_controller_with_rh_computes")

commit_message:
Fix job launching with cluster in any state

Now we can launch job only on clusters that in Active or Error state.
* added 'in {state} state' phrase to cluster selection field for
  clusters that in the state that differs from 'Active' state.
* added warning message for the choice of the cluster in the state
  that differs from 'Active' state.
* added 'No clusters available' message if there are no suitable
  clusters for a job launching.

Change-Id: I949b81290f94370eb0709f0a04e4d2ce39855323
bp: cluster-choice-for-jobs
closes-bug: 1430232
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/16/298816/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for cluster in clusters if cluster.status == 'Active']

commit_message:
Fix shutoff_vms cmd

Make function shutodd_vms runable

* Add close quote on awk format
* Run command on controller node
* Fix argument and subcommand order in nova list command

Change-Id: I767950b35b8b85a76833f38d5049de60079e68f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/73/309473/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: controller = env_util.get_one_controller(self.env) run_cmd = ". /root/openrc; nova --os-password {0} " \ "list --host {1}".format(password, self.node.data["hostname"]) run_cmd += "|awk -F\| \'$4~/ACTIVE/{print($2)}\'|xargs -I% nova stop %" ssh.call(["sh", "-c", run_cmd], stdout=ssh.PIPE, node=controller)
deleted_lines: cmd = ['. /root/openrc;', 'nova list --os-password {0} --host {1}' .format(password, self.node.data['hostname']), '|', 'awk -F\| \'$4~/ACTIVE/{print($2)}', '|', 'xargs -I% nova stop %'] out, err = ssh.call(cmd, stdout=ssh.PIPE, node=self.node)

commit_message:
Fix mysqld process matching

Make ps -C mysqld to match the datadir and exclude
wsrep_recover/wsrep-recover as well

Closes-bug: #1574999

Change-Id: I133b0c4ea3000aa896ae412591cfd5882016bcf9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/39/312839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pid=$(ps -C mysqld -o pid= -o args= | grep "${OCF_RESKEY_datadir}" | awk '!/wsrep.recover/ {print $1}')
deleted_lines: pid=$(ps -C mysqld -o pid= -o args= | awk -v v="${OCF_RESKEY_datadir}" \ '/datadir='$v'/ { if ($1 ~ !/wsrep-recover/) print $1}')

subject: New spec: composable services within roles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 14:53:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/commit/e9c1d22e6860cd16c8fba9340a8f0af307ef6b34', 'message': 'New spec: composable services within roles

Change-Id: I17a9cdda3c177984e2abae220fbddffc94eee3ef
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-17 13:07:56.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/composable-services-within-roles.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/commit/6ff658329fa0effd6610b09ec6c6c79532af2044', 'message': 'New spec: composable services within roles

Change-Id: I17a9cdda3c177984e2abae220fbddffc94eee3ef
'}]
commit_message:
New spec: composable services within roles

Change-Id: I17a9cdda3c177984e2abae220fbddffc94eee3ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/04/245804/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================ Composable Services Within Roles ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/composable-services-within-roles Create a mechanism that allows an operator to define which services compose a specific Overcloud role. (contoller, compute, etc.) Problem Description =================== Today in TripleO we have 5 basic Overcloud roles for: controller, compute, ceph storage, swift storage, and cinder storage. These roles can be scaled independantly and there are some boolean parameters to control various services and drivers within these roles but in general the role framework is rigidly defined with regards to which services run on each role. As we add more services and custom vendor drivers the existing framework (while very hackable) is proving not to scale very well. Rather than rigidly defined roles we desire a mechanism that would allow an operator to more freely define what services go into each role. Adding a new service should be pluggable, and not require editing a controller manifest that is already 100's of lines and growing. The goal of this spec is to move towards a framework that allows services that run on each roles to be flexible (as much as they can be) and make the maintenance involved with adding new services and drivers less painful. This means defining an "interface" that all services (core or not) must implement to work with our deployment framework. Taking it a step further we may eventually want to allow operators to create ad-hoc new roles as well. I think this is a great idea but is perhaps slighly beyond the initial scope of this spec which is focussed not on what roles we have... but rather what goes into them. Once we have the abilty to flexibally define the services for each role I think it could be a logical next step to tackle the "flexible roles" issue but perhaps that rigidly defining a couple more (like a database or neutron role) in the meantime would be us a lot of runway. Proposed Change =============== Overview -------- The idea is that we will split up our rigid roles into a set of much smaller roles (or perhaps traits) that outline how to configure and encapsulate an individual service (or small set of services). Each service role will be defined as a nested stack heat template which has its own parameters, and "role_data" outputs to drive the configuration (an updates) of that service to completion. The parameters for each services are free form (each services can choose its own parameters) however the role_data outputs from a specific service role nested stack heat template must be a JSON data scructure that may optionally define the following sections: * config_settings: this section drives any custom hiera data that is required to configure the service globally. All hiera data for a service generally should go here except for local bind ports, etc. which are handled within the node/server templates (more on this below). * config_steps_1: (Load Balancer) Any puppet includes or puppet manifest snippets that should run at config step 1. Optional. * config_steps_2: Core Services (Database/Rabbit) Any puppet includes or puppet manifest snippets that should run at config step 2. Optional. * config_steps_3: OpenStack Service setup (Swift Ringbuilder) Any puppet includes or puppet manifest snippets that should run at config step 3. Optional. * config_steps_4: OpenStack Services Any puppet includes or puppet manifest snippets that should run at config step 4. Optional. * config_steps_5: Service activation (Pacemaker) Any puppet includes or puppet manifest snippets that should run at config step 5. Optional. * config_steps_6: Post install, Fencing (Pacemaker) Any puppet includes or puppet manifest snippets that should run at config step 6. Optional. * container_urls: Custom docker (or other) container URLs that may be used to configure the service (used only for the docker implementation) * container_config: Custom container configuration. Typically this section would included docker-compose data related to a specific service. NOTE on config_settings ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ As mentioned above the config_settings data should contain all of the hiera required to configure a service except for bind ports, and/or custom per host network settings related to a service. In general this only includes local bind IP addresses, that must be configured alongside of the server/node object in TripleO Heat Templates. cinder::api::bind_host is an example of a hiera config that should not go into the config_settings section for a service role template but rather stay in controller.yaml (or perhaps another per server template as well). The reason we manage the per server host bind settings in the server templates is because that is the only place that currently has (clean) access to these port/IP addresses. The existance of these settings in the server templates won't cause functional configuration unless the associated puppet manifest enables the service. In this regard the service role templates config section should be thought of as "global" containing configuration data and VIPs that apply to all instances of a service within a cluster. NOTE on config_steps ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ In general we want the contents of each config_step section to be just an include(s) to puppet modules. Any inline manifests should be kept to a minimum so as to avoid potential "namespacing" issues when we reconstruct the template to run at deployment time on each node. This is a fairly major shift in tripleo-heat-templates and means that we will likely want to create individual role manifests (all very small and focussed) in puppet-tripleo to help model this data. The development workflow here should be impacted minimally as we also have recent patches which allow developers (and operators) to consume changes to puppet-tripleo without building an RPM package (thus things are still hackable locally). Top level params ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ We will strive to expose all service role parameters via the top level "overcloud" heat stack. Enabling service ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The goal would be to enable roles by simply choosing modifying a heat parameter. For the controller role we could add a new top level Heat parameter called 'ControllerServices' that would allow an operator to control the configured roles. Example: ControllerServices: default: - glance-api - glance-registry type: comma_delimited_list Using a Heat parameter is probably the simplest mechanism to implement this setting. As we move to towards ad-hoc role definitions (not in this spec) it is worth thinging about allows the user to free form the roles (perhaps this is even a good mechanism to move docker containers around a cluster, etc.). Imagine a format like testenv.json (what we currently feed to Ironic for provisioning) also contained a simple service role list that needed to be deployed on each node. Something like could be passed into our overcloud configuration stack and thus provide the outline for what services run where within a cluster. (Imagine moving docker containers, around in a similar fashion... all driven by a simple JSON file provided to the heat configuration stack). Alternatives ------------ * Continue to grow our rigig role manifests by adding (complex) conditionals and logic to accomidate all of the service combinations that users would like to have. This will likely continue to be painful as we add more vendor drivers to existing services and more core services alike. Security Impact --------------- The changes here only deal with how we implement and configure specific OpenStack services. We need to be careful to preserve existing settings when moving to the new service role implementation formats. Performance Impact ------------------ On the controller role we already have 6 deployment steps during each heat stack-create/update. The other 4 roles today (compute, ceph, swift, cinder) all use one or two steps for during deployment. We would likely want to modify all the roles to support a 6 step deployment process so that each of the config_steps is properly supported and thus portable across the roles. This may slighly increase the total deployment time for each compute node for example by a minute or two due to added heat callbacks and polling intervals, etc. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- Our default service lists would likely remain unchanged so deployers of stock tripleo-heat-templates would likely notice no differences but would gain extra configurability. Deployers who have highly customized defaults and drivers with tripleo-heat-templates would need to adopt the new service role formats. In some cases instead of using a boolean parameter to enable/disable a service we would now use the inclusion or exclusion of the role name in a Heat list parameter. It may be possible to work around some of these cases with tooling like tripleoclient to make the upgrades process more transparent. Developer Impact ---------------- Developers adding new roles would likely find it much easier to implement the well defined "interface" that is for the most part contained within a puppet-tripleo manifest and a single nested stack heat template. The ability to "hack" a single self-contained role manifest would be replaced with a workflow that looked something like this: * modify puppet-tripleo role manifest (in a local directory) * push updated puppet modules to Swift * modify tripleo-heat-templates nested stack role template * heat stack-update to test these changes The above would involve no RPM building but would still allow developers and operators to test slight tweaks and changes to the puppet modules and role templates. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- dan-prince Work Items ---------- * Splits the overcloud_controller.pp and overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp manifests into 6 individual steps that we then re-construct during deployment. This allows us to gradually implement and inject data from individual service roles in a patch series. For each role ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Create puppet-tripleo role manifest(s) * Create a heat nested stack template that uses the new puppet-tripleo manifest to configure/enable the service. * docker integration Dependencies ============ * We should have the upgrades job in place to ensure we don't break the ability to heat stack-update from a previous stack. Testing ======= * We would use the new configuration mechanism by default so it would automatically be tested in our CI. Additionally the upgrades job would ensure we don't break the upgrade process. Documentation Impact ==================== We would need to document any configuration heat parameter changes that aren't covered transparently by our tooling. This may involve documenting the deprecation (or removal) of some Heat boolean parameters in favor of using the new formats. References ========== * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/236243/ (patch series, example)

commit_message:
Prevent erroneous tasks running against localhost

The test-prepare-containers task runs connection as local, which ends up
running tasks against the local host that are not intended to be run,
for example the initial host's hostname is changed to that of the last
host it sets up. In this case "infra1".

This PR fixes that.

Change-Id: Id1aa1ad4ca177a8b60b07d8c9b3834507a3a0606
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/30/315430/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Prevent erroneous tasks running against localhost

The test-prepare-containers task runs connection as local, which ends up
running tasks against the local host that are not intended to be run,
for example the initial host's hostname is changed to that of the last
host it sets up. In this case "infra1".

This PR fixes that.

Change-Id: I4675d41a602ffd7534790e2aca09f6580148423f

commit_message:
Use OpenStack Foundation for setup.py copyright

So far the requirements update script copies a reference
to Hewlett-Packard Development Company to all projects that are
listed in projects.txt, which every once in a while stirs confusion.
Assigning the copyright to the Foundation should resolve this.

Change-Id: I2b654a5297e91cd5899457204b20cd1eb113ba60

commit_message:
Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

os.popen() is deprecated since version 2.6. Resolved with
use of subprocess module.

Change-Id: I21ce4678879302538239f570150b727375adc47c
Closes-bug: #1529836

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 12:13:29.000000000', 'files': ['tools/integration.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/466fcd315b534b8d164259639c2dd760923ae627', 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I2baa7b7b21c6d44305fdbb3639898c1ef4c258e3
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I2baa7b7b21c6d44305fdbb3639898c1ef4c258e3
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Install master's version of an RDO keystone"

This was a temporary workaround because RDO didn't update to
keystone bootstrap command operations.

This reverts commit c5f27aa8a69cffd4393ad56dbee1acd7ed5ba4bf.

Closes-Bug: #1573102

Change-Id: Ic6db97cf15d6f96c8e660aa15f089c1f10d6dfa7

commit_message:
Get servers filtered by host status

When querying servers it needs to be possible to get only those servers that
are in specific host state.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I0ecc476f362e3469053b334a615676951b3831c1
Implements: blueprint servers-by-host-status
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/71/276671/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Get servers filtered by host status ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/servers-by-host-status When querying servers it needs to be possible to get only those servers that are in specific host state. Problem description =================== Admin or if in some deployment the default policy is changed also owner of server wants to query his servers to get servers that has host in specific state. Currently one get all the servers as there is no filtering implemented to get by a specific host state. Use Cases --------- As user I want to query servers that has host in specific state, so I can plan my actions. Proposed change =============== GET /servers/detail should be possible to filter according to host_status. This is similar to other filtering already implemented and just adding the same feature for ``host_status`` attribute added in this API in Mitaka release. Alternatives ------------ If same information is wanted one would have to list all servers and do filtering by oneself from response message. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- New API microversion is needed to filter servers by ``host_status``. New ``host_status`` search filter for GET /servers/detail request will be created. Filtering with single status:: GET /v2.1/servers/detail?host_status=UP Response:: 200 OK { "servers": [ { "host_status": "UP", ... }, { "host_status": "UP", ... } ] } Filtering with multiple statuses:: GET /v2.1/servers/detail?"host_status=DOWN&host_status=UNKNOWN" Response:: 200 OK { "servers": [ { "host_status": "DOWN", ... }, { "host_status": "UNKNOWN", ... } ] } In case host_status filter is not matching to allowed values: "UP", "DOWN", "MAINTENANCE", "UNKNOWN" or "", it will cause error:: {"badRequest": {"message": "Invalid host_status filter, "code": 400}} Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: tomi-juvonen-q Work Items ---------- New API microversion for the new search filter. Dependencies ============ Completes work done in Mitaka: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/get-valid-server-state Testing ======= Unit and functional tests will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== Filtering need to be documented for new microversion. References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Newton - Introduced

commit_message:
Stop using git:// and be nice to people behind proxy servers

The build of tinyipa is doing a: git clone git://...

Doing a git clone git://... behind a proxy server is painful. Use the
'official' QEMU github mirror and clone with https.

Change-Id: Ia14835e6867b945cccb8b1987aa4881d8524561c
Closes-Bug: #1578778
(cherry picked from commit 4be5e084080cde8e53dd83e21a4ac9da3a12b6b2)

commit_message:
Fix typo in ceph-osd YAQL expression

This is a simple one-line fix to fix a typo in YAQL expression
for ceph-osd: values should be a function call instead of attribute
fetching.

Change-Id: I20d7e3b00b371e86bef9b17b6b4c343db271fbe3
Closes-bug: #1578584

commit_message:
Fix invalid config serialization for primary- roles

Roles that are passed via parameter to function
inject_configs retrieved from `objects.Node.all_roles`
function. This function adds prefix `primary-` to
generic role names.
In this case configuration, that was created for role
`controller`, won't be executed on `primary-controller`
node, since role `controller` was replaced with
`primary-controller`

Change-Id: Ibba3a1d25079bd7b356e8e65da11c19a8017d4ba
Closes-Bug: #1576127

subject: Fix wrong CPU metric value in metrics_filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 18:18:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/monitor_metric.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_monitor_metric.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c0dfe42382262f044471d0a852c6b724e8e81ad8', 'message': "Fix wrong CPU metric value in metrics_filter

CPU metrics are reported as a normalized value in [0,1].
When scheduler reads the data as MonitorMetric object, as part
of update_from_compute_node(), the value of the metric gets
lost due to a wrong type conversion, typecasting into an Integer,
reduces it to 0.

Note:
 - It may seem unintuitive that to fix the same, we are not changing
   the type of metric from Integer to Float. Please refer the
   discussions -
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243825/
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216923/
 - To summarize, we are trying to save some 'possible' downstream consumer
   of metrics updates from compute nodes, i.e. consuming from AMPQ, from
   software upgrade scenarios.

Change-Id: Ib504af33e05dfc4d7e97b52682e27befc67d784a
Closes-bug: #1514997
(cherry picked from commit ddb3c4e26f3a908de7836a8fac48360afa6aa1d7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong CPU metric value in metrics_filter

CPU metrics are reported as a normalized value in [0,1].
When scheduler reads the data as MonitorMetric object, as part
of update_from_compute_node(), the value of the metric gets
lost due to a wrong type conversion, typecasting into an Integer,
reduces it to 0.

Note:
 - It may seem unintuitive that to fix the same, we are not changing
   the type of metric from Integer to Float. Please refer the
   discussions -
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243825/
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216923/
 - To summarize, we are trying to save some 'possible' downstream consumer
   of metrics updates from compute nodes, i.e. consuming from AMPQ, from
   software upgrade scenarios.

Change-Id: Ib504af33e05dfc4d7e97b52682e27befc67d784a
Closes-bug: #1514997
(cherry picked from commit ddb3c4e26f3a908de7836a8fac48360afa6aa1d7)

commit_message:
Fix retry mechanism for generator results

Both v1 and v2 of the glance client return python generators in some
cases (rather than fully fleshed out lists) which thwarts our retry
mechanism. Convert generator results to a list, so that any potential
exceptions get raised earlier rather than later, allowing for retries.

Conflicts:

    /nova/tests/unit/image/test_glance.py

Conflict notes: I couldn't add the following assert from master because
client.api_servers didn't exist then. It was added in commit
590b2c30073843f736680cdea4d6a6f8c673d725. Instead, I added one that
follows the pattern at that time.

  self.assertEqual(str(client.api_server), "https://host2:9293")

Change-Id: Ibc84f1596d4eaabdef0a48f6cf4da2d1323843a8
Closes-Bug: #1557584
(cherry picked from commit ae6d868e2f13f90d9f97c982fdbbccdc6fb8b9c9)

commit_message:
Apply feature_groups settings in Nailgun

Apply feature_groups settings in Nailgun only during post-deployment
phase (when Fuel master is installed) and only if they were changed.

Change-Id: Ia849153e15f4bd9ab568221374a7f8ef2fb6c52d
Closes-Bug: #1578979
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-menu refs/changes/35/314235/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from fuelmenu.common import utils from fuelmenu import consts if utils.is_post_deployment(): # Apply changes to the Nailgun cmd = ["puppet", "apply", "--debug", "--verbose", "--logdest", consts.PUPPET_LOGFILE, "/etc/puppet/modules/fuel/examples/nailgun.pp"] err_code, _, errout = utils.execute(cmd) if err_code != 0: log.error("Puppet apply failed with an error: " "\"{0}\"".format(errout)) self.parent.footer.set_text("Puppet apply failed. " "Check logs for more details.") return False self.parent.footer.set_text("Changes successfully applied.")

commit_message:
remove record_metering_data method from collector

This method is serving for rpc publisher, which doesn't exist any
more, hence for now it should not exist neither.

Change-Id: I3fa3933496a279f8a5a0f42afc5fb8c5d6cf90ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/47/313547/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def record_metering_data(self, context, data): """RPC endpoint for messages we send to ourselves. When the notification messages are re-published through the RPC publisher, this method receives them for processing. """ self.meter_manager.map_method('record_metering_data', data=data)

revisions:

Change-Id: Ia00b2ef3727ba263ea2ce1645b494adc6dd25fef
'}]
commit_message:
Configure LVM filter to only allow cinder device

This patch changes /etc/lvm/lvm.conf to allow only the device used
for cinder and to reject all other devices, as suggested in the
install-guide.

Change-Id: Ia00b2ef3727ba263ea2ce1645b494adc6dd25fef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/11/313911/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cinder_dev=sdb sudo pvcreate /dev/$cinder_dev sudo vgcreate cinder-volumes /dev/$cinder_dev conf=/etc/lvm/lvm.conf echo "Setting LVM filter line in $conf to only allow /dev/$cinder_dev:" sudo sed -i '/^[[:space:]]\{1,\}filter/ s|= .*|= [ "a/'$cinder_dev'/", "r/.*/"]|' $conf grep "^[[:space:]]\{1,\}filter" $conf
deleted_lines: cinder_dev=/dev/sdb sudo pvcreate $cinder_dev sudo vgcreate cinder-volumes $cinder_dev # We could configure LVM to only use the device we just set up, but scanning # our block devices to find our volume group is fast enough.

commit_message:
Add ssh public key to Fuel master node

This commit adds an ability to use ssh public key authentication for
the Fuel master node by uploading your ssh public key to it. The path
to the public key file can be provided in the 'config.sh' file.

Closes-Bug: #1579123
Change-Id: I93560126940457518fc4385c0518ab00c0cac01a
(cherry picked from commit 904eec20f8bee54f9b620b06779776bb77210461)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-virtualbox refs/changes/89/315489/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If necessary uncomment and edit line below to add your public ssh key to the master node #public_key_file="${HOME}/.ssh/id_rsa.pub"

commit_message:
Support single-AZ deployment

This supports the case where OpenStack is deployed with a single AZ
for both controller(s) and compute(s), and not all hosts in the AZ
that contains an instance are guaranteed to have the nova-compute
service.

Change-Id: If5a8bd0df863b94f3c3e7117df4586dbc56f48bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/23/315023/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix volume test uuid warnings in api.contrib

This commit fixes invalid uuid usage in the various
volume unit tests under cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib,
cleaning up FutureWarnings from oslo_versioned_objects [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: I526f9cf1c383f75490f1ac86c0fc5182376f5b3e

commit_message:
DOC - Removing incorrect doc about installation workflow

There was a reference to playbook that did not exist and
lots of content about operations that do not take place when
executing the referenced playbook.

Change-Id: I138609eb4f2528a91b39adc3b6689c88e593ae88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/80/313580/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The main OpenStack-Ansible playbook installs OpenStack services and- Install Block Storage (cinder)- Install Orchestration (heat)- Install Telemetry (ceilometer and aodh) - Install Object Storage (swift)
deleted_lines: The main Ansible OpenStack playbook installs OpenStack services and- Install common components - Create a utility container that provides utilities to interact with services in other containers - Generate service IDs for all services - Install Orchestration (heat)- Install Block Storage (cinder)- Reconfigure Rsyslog The ``openstack-common.yml`` sub-playbook builds all OpenStack services from source and takes up to 30 minutes to complete. As the playbook progresses, the quantity of containers in the polling state approaches zero.
